title: Cover, late 17th–early 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped thread on a silk core, metal sequins, metal coils
Technique: plain couching stitches on 8-harness satin plus plain weave (damasse); some couched areas padded with strips of paper or parchment; bobbin lace
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Frederick W. Greenfield
description: Cover with metallic threads on an dark orange foundation in a vertically symmetrical pattern of flowers with continuous frame at the left and right sides. Floral medallion in center and floral border symmetrical in corners and center of each side. Bobbin lace on four sides.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cover, late 17th–early 18th century.
late 17th–early 18th century. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped thread on a silk core, metal sequins, metal coils
Technique: plain couching stitches on 8-harness satin plus plain weave (damasse); some couched areas padded with strips of paper or parchment; bobbin lace. Gift of Mrs. Frederick W. Greenfield. 1975-53-1.
